data.title: Germany Area Code
data.meta_description: Germany Area Code: Want to get connected in Germany? Here is a list of country codes, area codes, postal codes, and phone codes for Germany.
data.text:
4.2K

Area codes of Germany assist to commute and communicat anywhere in Germany.

Germany Codes consist of German zip codes or postal codes of each region of the country, area code, and Germany (German: Deutschlandkarte) country calling or phone code. German Zip Code is also known as Postleitzahlen or abbreviated as “PLZ” in the native language.

Technically, a Postleitzahlenor a German Zip Code is a five-digit number consisting of the wider area that is placed on the thousandth position and the postal district that replaces the unit, tenth and hundredth positions. This system of writing Postal codes in Germany was introduced on 1 July 1993. Before the reunification of East and West Germany, their Postal Codes comprised of 4-digits only. Every house in Germany has a postal or a Zip code depending upon the respective region it belongs to.

The following are the Germany Codes of the different various regions:

Sachsen and Sachsen-Anhalt Region:

01 for Region Dresden. Eg. Range includes 01001-01462

02 for Region Bautzen. Eg. 02xxx

04 for Region Leipzig Eg. 04xxx

06 for Region Halle an der Saale/Dessau.

08 for Region Zwickau

09 for Region Chemnitz Eg. 09xxx

Berlin Area consists of Zip codes from 10115 – 14199

Brandenburg Region Zip codes range 01000 – 01999

Frankfurt and Surrounding Region Zip codes range 15201-15236

Mecklenburg-Vorpommern PLZ – 17000-17999

Hamburg Region lies within Zip codes 20000-20999

Schleswig-Holstein Region Zip codes – 21000-21999

Bremen Zip codes – 28000-28999

Niedersachsen Region have Zip code from 05000-05999

Thüringen Region has Zip codes 04000-04999

Nordrhein-Westfalen Region extends from 32000-32999

Rheinland-Pfalz Region lies within Zip codes 53000-53999

Hessen lies within Zip codes 35000-35999

Saarland lies within Zip codes 66000-66999

Baden-Württemberg Region have Zip codes 69000-69999

Bayern and Surrounding Regions have Zip codes 63000-63999

Germany Area Code or the German Vorwahl is the area calling code of each town or city irrespective of its size. The Vorwahl is made of two to five digits, excluding the first zero. The zero is omitted when a telephone is made from an overseas country like India, Japan, the U.S.A., or the U.K. the initial “0” before the Area Code is dialed while a call is made from Germany but a different region. However, in the case of local calls “0” is not needed.

Larger cities have a shorter Area Code and smaller cities and towns have an extended Area Code in Germany. Another feature of Germany Codes is that private telephones in bigger cities have longer dialing numbers usually seven to eight digits while smaller towns have only three or four-digit private numbers.

The country Telephone Code of Germany is “+49” or “0049”. International calls can only be made to Germany by using this Germany Codes number at the initial stage of dialing.
